documentation.text: @dev Interface of Passify core smart contract
@dev Emitted when `user` makes payment to unlock password stored in `recordId`.
@dev Emitted when `user` disputes that `custodian` has returned correct data for `recordId`.
@dev User calls this function when they register a new record. No fees paid.

CURRENTLY UNIMPLEMENTED
 @dev User calls this function when they contend that custodians have not sent
 the correct information
 Emits a {Dispute} event
@dev Returns all registered custodians.
@dev Returns the URI that holds custodian information.
@dev Returns all registered custodians.

devdoc.details: Interface of Passify core smart contract

Dispute(address,uint256,address).details: Emitted when `user` disputes that `custodian` has returned correct data for `recordId`.

Pay(address,uint256).details: Emitted when `user` makes payment to unlock password stored in `recordId`.

addRecord(address[]).details: User calls this function when they register a new record. No fees paid.

dispute(uint256,address).details: User calls this function when they contend that custodians have not sent the correct information Emits a {Dispute} event

getCustodianURI(address).details: Returns the URI that holds custodian information.

pay(uint256).details: User calls this function when they wish to unlock their password (after verifying their identity). Emits a {Pay} event

stake().details: Custodian calls this function to register their service on our platform Requirement: msg.value >= fixed stake amount
